name: NH Brugge

reviews.text: Some friends and I decided to visit Bruges for a weekend and we ended up booking this hotel (3 double rooms for 6 people).
reviews.title: Great Location and massive rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location, you can easily walk to Bruges city centre and the market square just outside has lots of good bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, just don't get your hopes too high with the "spa"!

reviews.text: The rooms were really big. We had two double beds per room, which is not common in continental Europe. The hotel also had a nice bar, ideal to taste some local beers.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, friendly staff in superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff was also helpful and was happy to recommend places to go to in Bruges.
reviews.title: Exemplary staff, great location, a lovely place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel, definitely to be considered when visiting this city.
reviews.title: Excellent for a weekend city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here with friends and we all agreed it was a smart, clean hotel. The decor is a bit 'boutique' dark, but nice. The rooms were quite large with large beds, and the bathroom was spotless with a good shower. The staff were very helpful with tourist information and directions, and at breakfast nothing was too much trouble. The hot food was continually changed and topped up, and nothing ever ran out. It's in a great location only five minutes walk from the main square where most of the restaurants are, although there quite a few bar style eateries opposite the hotel which are good. Our friends had to leave before breakfast so the hotel put them up a packed breakfast, which they said was really good. We would stay here again. the hotel doesn't have parking, but they direct you to the nearby underground carpark which is very well lit and spacious, at the moment is costs 9 euro per day.
reviews.title: Good hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm really surprised that this hotel has such good reviews. We stayed there 7 years ago when it was the Sofitel, and it was really very good then, but it hasn't been well maintained and we were disappointed.
reviews.title: OKAY, BUT IT'S NOT FOUR STAR
Excelent, worth quality-price
reviews.text: The location is excellent, can't fault that, and the staff are extremely friendly. Also, the beds are comfortable. However, the bathroom needed refurbishing (and we paid extra for an upgraded room) and there was a slightly shabby air to the room. It didn't smell too fresh when we walked in. The decor throughout the building is very dark and oppressive.

I chose this hotel because we wanted to use the pool, steam room and fitness room. The leisure facilities were particularly shabby (the steam room was pretty horrible) and we didn't bother getting in the pool. Lots of floor tiles missing. Such a shame, as it used to be really nice.
reviews.title: Great Location - need to work on the attitude of staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, all in all, I wouldn't go again.
reviews.title: Excellent but dont order the steak in the restaurant

reviews.text: 10 of us stayed here for one night in November to celebrate my wife's 50th. Went on the overnight ferry from Hull to Zeebrugge. Many hotels in central Bruges only allow at least a two night stay, we only required just one night so chose NH.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel which made our trip special
Pleasant Chritmas stay - not easy to book a family room
reviews.text: Some of us could access our rooms straight away (about 10am) the rest could leave luggage in the hotel. The hotel was spacious with a number of areas to 'lounge' in. It also had a swimming pool which we didn't use.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in 'superior rooms', the five we had were all different but were large had a pleasant decor, very large bed, bathroom with bath and shower. Our room looked over the busy T'Zand square, the noise was hardly detectable due to the triple glazing.
reviews.title: Good location, average hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, self service. The staff were very helpful, nothing seemed too much trouble.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the heart of Brugge

reviews.text: We left our luggage in the hotel luggage room on the sunday before picking it up to get the bus to the ferry.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel.

reviews.text: Within easy walking distance of the station, the hotel is very convenient fror all the major sights. The rooms are spacious and the beds very large and comfortable. We enjoyed the bar and breakfast was very good. We liked the look of the pool but never got round to using it. Would definitely returrn.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a few days after the Easter weekend. The description said it was partly a converted monastry, which attracted us, but infact it is more conference-like than we had expected. However, our room was really big, with an extremely comfortable bed, lovely big bathroom and overlooking a quiet courtyard garden. The hotel pool, steam room and gym (brand new equipment) were all really quiet and are open from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. which meant we actually got to use them (other hotels facilities often close earlier than this). We had booked this hotel because we expected the weather to be bad and wanted somewhere with a log-fire to sit and relax by with a glass of wine. As it happened, the weather was warm so we didn't need this but there were several fire places and areas to sit which would have been great had we needed them. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as we prefer to go out - and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. We had read a tip on trip advisor about parking at the station - brilliant idea - we parked there for 3 days and it only cost 7 Euros in total. There are regular buses into the square in front of the hotel and it's a 5 minute trip costing 1.20 Euros - would definately do that again. There were lots of americans staying at this hotel who went out each day on trips, other than that it seemed fairly quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful - they booked a cycle trip up for us. We would stay at this hotel again if we could get a good deal again (which we did via laterooms.com).
reviews.title: Good Location, Lovely Room, Good Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying in a smaller 3 star hotel in Paris for 4 nights, we were pleasantly surprised to stay at the NH Brugge for the final leg of our trip. The room was a very good size with a great view of the square. The king size bed was heaven compared to the double we had in Paris. The location was perfect (only a 10 minutes walk from the train station, or 2 minute bus ride) and close to all the shops and resturants.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff-We Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you view the location of this hotel on the map, it does not appear right in the middle of the town. Trust me, you dont have to be. You are less than 5 minutes to everywhere you want to go.
reviews.title: Great choice for Bruges

reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and the morning breakfast was more than adequate.
reviews.title: FABULOUS HOTEL, FABULOUS LOCATION*************
